derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from Latin sens- 'perceived' (from the verb sentire) or from the noun sense + -ory

entry.def: Sensory means relating to the physical senses.

example.ex: ...sensory information passing through the spinal cord.
example.tran: 经过脊髓传送的感官信息

means.word_mean: 1. of a nerve fiber or impulse originating outside and passing toward the central nervous system;
2. involving or derived from the senses;
3. relating to or concerned in sensation;

stems_affixes.word_buile: sens感觉+ibility具备……性质的→adj.感觉[力],敏感性

stems_affixes.value_cn: 明智的,达理的;可觉察的,明显的
stems_affixes.word_buile: sens感觉+ible能……的→能感觉的→明显的
sens感觉+itive……的→adj.[to]敏感的,易受伤害的;灵敏的
non不,无+sens感觉+e→无感觉,无意义
